intro: Sida paucifolia, commonly known as slender sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial species that typically grows in dry, disturbed habitats. The plant features small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are often hairy and oval in shape. Sida paucifolia is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
